sourceDesc.p: his is the feature-file for the Future marker (e.g. raḥ, ḥ-, b- ...).

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

cit.quote: I am not going to continue like this
one like her will come (talking about a tv serie)
you will see him for sure
I am going to my family
when will you slaughter the sheep?
you will go to the doctor
ma raḥ taṭlaʕ min manṭegat al-Balga
You will not leave the Balga region
ʔiḏa kān fi ʕind-hum dār biskin bi-n-nafs ad-dār
if they own a house, he will live in the same house

wib:featureValueObservation.note: This marker is attested only once in the corpus and used by a 25 years old speaker.

cit.quote: We will meet in the house.
they will discuss this topic tomorrow
What will happen with the river?

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The ap form rāyəḥ f rāyḥa is also used to express future intent and occurs once in my corpus (āna rāyḥa (a)sawwī-lak ‘I will make (for) you …’).

cit.quote: I am not going to the market.
he is going to write a book / he will write a book

wib:featureValueObservation.note: This adverbial particle denotes the indefinite future

cit.quote: he is going to write a book / he will write a book

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Variants of ser include se and sa

cit.quote: I (sg.m.) am going to go shopping
I (sg.f.) am going to go eat
We are going to go dancing
they will go to school early
they will go to school early

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Whilst this is used especially by younger speakers, in Benghazi the future is often expressed by a full word which expresses the future, e.g. bukra nimšī li-d-dukkān 'tomorrow I will go to the shop'
This is used to express the very near future
In rapid speech it is shortened to yib- or ibi-
This is used to express the very near future

cit.quote: Lunch will not come to you (pl.)
әn-nās ḥa-tkūn kull wāḥәd yaʕni yidbaḥ
People will be, I mean, everybody offers a sacrifice

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The ḥa- marker is used for the simple future

cit.quote: This is the first one who plays

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The b- marker is used to express will

cit.quote: I am not going to give you the money
he will go, wants to go

wib:featureValueObservation.note: b- is used to express volition

cit.quote: I shall speak, am going to speak

wib:featureValueObservation.note: rāḥ is used to express intention

cit.quote: And I shall go hunting, and come (back) to you
gāl: bi-tsiddih b-ēh? gāl ān b-āxīḏ...
He said: What will you block it with? He said: I'll take...

wib:featureValueObservation.note: raḥ- is mostly used in Jeddah

cit.quote: We intend to go to Benghazi

wib:featureValueObservation.note: This is mainly used to express the future of intention in affirmative or interrogative statements, as well as marking finality, will and possibility

cit.quote: I am going to go to Tripoli

wib:featureValueObservation.note: This prefix marks the near future

cit.quote: We are going to pay money

wib:featureValueObservation.note: yḥəbb can be substituted with the shortened forms ḥəm/ḥən for the 1.p. and ḥət for the 2.p. and 3.p.f. No short forms are attested for the 3.p.m.

cit.quote: Abdallah is going to have breakfast now

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The vowel of the future marker varies due to the phonetic envoronment, it can thus be b-, bə-, bi-, ba-, bā.

cit.quote: he will write vs. she will write

wib:featureValueObservation.note: no seperate future marker; imperfective for present if started and future if not yet started; b-prefix for 1.P.Sg, 3.P.Sg.m., 3.P.Pl (vocalic prefixes).

cit.quote: How will you go to Tunis?

wib:featureValueObservation.note: ra + Pers Pronoun suffix + imperfective, but it is not obligatory, otherwise no marker
ra + Pers Pronoun suffix + imperfective, but it is not obligatory, otherwise no marker
mostly invariable, may also be the apocope form ġa-, some speakers use the feminine form ġada
inflected forms māši, māšya ~ māša (f), māšyin ~ māšin
inflected forms ġada ~ ġadya (f), ġadin, but already tendency to invariable form
ra- Pers Pronoun suffix + rāyəḥ (infelcted form)
invariable, may also be the apocope form ġa-
invariable, may also be the apocope form ġa-

cit.quote: I will come to you tomorrow
fīh wāḥid fī marīḏ̣ bā ymūt
there is someone ill who will die

wib:featureValueObservation.note: The dialects of the Yāfiʕ area that have a b- prefix in the imperfect use ʔā- for future marker.
